body: Can you show how you signed your app? It seems that you didn't give network permissions when sandboxing your app.

Try adding these to your entitlements: 

```
    <key>com.apple.security.network.client</key>
    <true/>
```

@positlabs I added those keys to both parent.plist and child.plist. 

child.plist
`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
  <dict>
    <key>com.apple.security.app-sandbox</key>
    <true/>
    <key>com.apple.security.inherit</key>
    <true/>
    <key>com.apple.security.network.client</key>
    <true/>
  </dict>
</plist>
`

parent.plist
`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
  <dict>
    <key>com.apple.security.app-sandbox</key>
    <true/>
    <key>com.apple.security.network.client</key>
    <true/>
  </dict>
</plist>
`
Should I be adding these keys to both plist files?

On pkg install  I still get the error

How are you creating the pkg? 

Are there any errors in Mac Console?

1
Create app 

```
electron-packager ./jarvis-desktop/ Messenger --platform=darwin --arch=all --version=0.35.4 --asar=true --overwrite --icon=./jarvis-desktop/assets/mac-icon.icns
```

2

Create package

```
#!/bin/bash

# Name of your app.
APP="Messenger"
# The path of you app to sign.
APP_PATH="/Users/bryan.jowers/OSX-Messenger/Messenger.app"
# The path to the location you want to put the signed package.
RESULT_PATH="/Users/bryan.jowers/OSX-Messenger/$APP.pkg"
# The name of certificates you requested.
APP_KEY="3rd Party Mac Developer Application: Bryan Jowers (9DSX88656N)"
INSTALLER_KEY="3rd Party Mac Developer Installer: Bryan Jowers (9DSX88656N)"

FRAMEWORKS_PATH="$APP_PATH/Contents/Frameworks"

codesign --deep -fs "$APP_KEY" --entitlements child.plist "$FRAMEWORKS_PATH/Electron Framework.framework/Versions/A"
codesign --deep -fs "$APP_KEY" --entitlements child.plist "$FRAMEWORKS_PATH/$APP Helper.app/"
codesign --deep -fs "$APP_KEY" --entitlements child.plist "$FRAMEWORKS_PATH/$APP Helper EH.app/"
codesign --deep -fs "$APP_KEY" --entitlements child.plist "$FRAMEWORKS_PATH/$APP Helper NP.app/"
if [ -d "$FRAMEWORKS_PATH/Squirrel.framework/Versions/A" ]; then
  # Signing a non-MAS build.
  codesign --deep -fs "$APP_KEY" --entitlements child.plist "$FRAMEWORKS_PATH/Mantle.framework/Versions/A"
  codesign --deep -fs "$APP_KEY" --entitlements child.plist "$FRAMEWORKS_PATH/ReactiveCocoa.framework/Versions/A"
  codesign --deep -fs "$APP_KEY" --entitlements child.plist "$FRAMEWORKS_PATH/Squirrel.framework/Versions/A"
fi
codesign -fs "$APP_KEY" --entitlements parent.plist "$APP_PATH"
productbuild --component "$APP_PATH" /Applications --sign "$INSTALLER_KEY" "$RESULT_PATH"
```

```
productbuild: Adding component at /Users/bryan.jowers/OSX-Messenger/Messenger.app
productbuild: Signing product with identity "3rd Party Mac Developer Installer: Bryan Jowers (9DSX88656N)" from keychain /Library/Keychains/System.keychain

productbuild: Wrote product to /Users/bryan.jowers/OSX-Messenger/Messenger.pkg
productbuild: Supported OS versions: [10.8.0, )
```

3
Install Package

```
sudo installer -store -pkg Messenger.pkg -target /
installer: Note: running installer as an admin user (instead of root) gives better Mac App Store fidelity

installer: Finished install
```

I get the same result when I double click Messenger.pkg :(
Sorry I deleted that comment after realizing my whole build is broken. Nothing to do with that command

Here is something strange. I can't make sense of this: 

```
spctl --ignore-cache --no-cache --assess --type install --verbose=4 "/Users/bryan.jowers/OSX-Messenger/Messenger.pkg" --raw
/Users/bryan.jowers/OSX-Messenger/Messenger.pkg: rejected
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">

    <key>assessment:authority</key>

    <key>assessment:verdict</key>
    <false/>

```

However, when I run installer, it says my certs are :+1: 

![screen shot 2016-02-29 at 3 04 58 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4181898/13412106/d9b5e2cc-def5-11e5-96ab-8a1697e08e9d.png)
Just adding that context just in case its helpful. But based on the GUI cert, looks like everything checks out

I had some issue with packaging a while back, and I fixed it by updating the Apple Dev Cert. Does yours expire in 2023?

![screen shot 2016-02-29 at 3 16 25 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1918844/13412332/6e821d2a-def7-11e5-9c85-0a99bc979e69.png)

I know what you are talking about. I did that last week. 

![screen shot 2016-02-29 at 3 22 25 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4181898/13412466/46112c7c-def8-11e5-80af-fcd677b58fb5.png)

I don't think it is the cert. I have a strong feeling it is: 
`2/29/16 2:33:20.000 PM kernel[0]: Sandbox: Messenger Helper(8535) deny(1) forbidden-sandbox-reinit`

I think it is a sandboxing issue.

I think I've solved it. Doing a bit more testing... 

It was a sandbox issue. Relating to https://github.com/atom/electron/issues/4599#issuecomment-190354328

I had additional entries in child.plist. I removed and only have them in parent.plist and everything works. @positlabs thank you so much for your assitance.
Wow. Good to know! Congrats!
